title: Small scale nuclear to get green light this week
description: Plans for a generation of new smaller nuclear reactors will become more concrete this week.

title: Newtownabbey: Bus hijacked and set on fire by gang
description: They ordered the passengers and driver off the bus in Newtownabbey and set it on fire, police say.

title: Sudan coup: Protesters tear-gassed at rally in Khartoum
description: Protesters are demanding the military step back and allow the transition to civilian rule.

title: Garth's team of the week: Who is Man City's silent assassin?
description: Who is starting to come to the boil? Who is Manchester City's silent assassin? And which player is destined to play Champions League football? Find out in Garth Crooks' team of the week.

title: Twitter poll calls on Elon Musk to sell 10% stake in Tesla
description: The Tesla boss had promised to honour the outcome of the poll, whichever way it went.

title: UK-EU trade deal 'could collapse over NI row'
description: The UK is laying foundations to suspend parts of the NI Protocol, says the Irish foreign minister.

title: Verstappen extends title lead over Hamilton with Mexico City win
description: Red Bull's Max Verstappen takes a dominant victory in the Mexico City Grand Prix to strengthen his chances of a first world championship.

title: 'Why not dream?' - are West Ham serious title contenders after Liverpool win?
description: Four Premier League wins in a row, third in the table and three points behind leaders Chelsea - is it time to consider West Ham genuine title challengers?

title: Why Man Utd are sticking with Solskjaer
description: Manchester United's derby defeat by City on Saturday has brought more calls for manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer to be dismissed, as their poor form continues.

title: Emma Raducanu confident of having new coach in place for 2022
description: Emma Raducanu says she will have a new coach in place for January's Australian Open.

title: Scotland edge tight contest with Australia to earn successive autumn wins
description: Scotland edged a taut contest to claim a third consecutive victory over Australia and continue their winning start to the Autumn Nations Series.

title: WW2 hero dog celebrated with statue in Strathaven
description: The life-size bronze statue is erected of Khan who saved his handler from drowning.

title: Aston Villa sack manager Smith after five league defeats in a row
description: Aston Villa sack manager Dean Smith after five successive Premier League defeats.

title: George Harrison's childhood home up for auction

title: Owen Paterson: Boris Johnson's actions corrupt - Starmer

title: Iraqi PM al-Kadhimi survives drone attack on his home
description: Mustafa al-Kadhimi says he was not hurt in the attack by a drone carrying explosives in Baghdad.

title: Covid: Get booster jabs so we can enjoy Christmas - Javid
description: The health secretary urges people to join the "national mission" to avoid restrictions over winter.

title: COP26: Countries must make bold compromises at summit - PM
description: Officials must "pull together" as the climate summit in Glasgow enters its final week, Boris Johnson says.

title: Libya: Row over attempt to suspend foreign minister Najla El-Mangoush
description: There has been political infighting after comments she made to the BBC about the 1988 Lockerbie bombing.

title: Cork: Gardaí charge man in MP threat investigation

title: Harvey Milk: US Navy launches ship named for gay rights leader
description: The USNS Harvey Milk is one of six new ships named after famous civil rights leaders.

title: Mexican superstar Alvarez stops Plant to make super-middleweight history
description: Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez makes history in Las Vegas by becoming the first undisputed world super-middleweight champion.

title: Covid-19: Get booster to enjoy Christmas, and court blocks Biden's jab plan
description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Sunday morning.

title: From bright lights to great heights - stories you may have missed
description: Our weekly video round-up of some of the stories that might have passed you by: In Case You Missed It.

description: Plans for mandatory booster jabs for travel and the latest sleaze claims feature on the front pages.

description: Eight people died after a deadly crowd surge during a performance by rapper Travis Scott.

title: Climate change: National Trust joins international call for peat product ban
description: The organisation says peat bogs should be left alone as they trap carbon.

title: How did Red Bull miss out on front row in Mexico City?

description: A Labour council is trying to do something different to boost its area - and Westminster is watching.

title: Sudan coup protesters: 'They cannot kill us all'
description: Despite the bloody crackdown, many Sudanese remain determined to overturn the military takeover.

title: Nicaragua's Ortega courts isolation with one-sided vote
description: With most of the opposition candidates in jail, the president looks set to win another term.

title: Former K-Pop star Henry Lau's art work on show in London

title: Premier League: Manchester United have to change manager to compete - Murphy
